title: How to Refinish a Front Door

steps.headline: Remove door from hinges and place on a flat surface.
Tape and seal any exposed glass and remove all hardware.
Apply paint stripper generously to the entire surface.
Go back and apply paint stripper in small areas until you see it bubble off its surface.
Take the bubbled section and scrape it off with putty knife and discard.
steps.description: This may require a Teflon brush in the profiles of the door.

steps.headline: Take a coarse sponge and clean the door with lacquer thinner.
Sand the entire door with an orbital sander.
steps.description: In most cases, 120 grit works great. You will need to hand sand the profile edges. Keep going until you achieve a clean and smooth surface.

steps.headline: Apply the color of stain that you want.
steps.description: Apply liberally and give the wood what it wants.

steps.headline: Spray a generous, yet smooth coat of exterior varnish.
steps.description: Find the varnish with the highest UV protection. This is key to a lasting finish. Use a minimum of two applications.

text: Remove door from hinges and place on a flat surface.  Tape and seal any exposed glass and remove all hardware.  Apply paint stripper generously to the entire surface.  Go back and apply paint stripper in small areas until you see it bubble off its surface.  Take the bubbled section and scrape it off with putty knife and discard. This may require a Teflon brush in the profiles of the door. Take a coarse sponge and clean the door with lacquer thinner.  Sand the entire door with an orbital sander. In most cases, 120 grit works great. You will need to hand sand the profile edges. Keep going until you achieve a clean and smooth surface. Apply the color of stain that you want. Apply liberally and give the wood what it wants. Wipe any excess stain off.  Spray a generous, yet smooth coat of exterior varnish. Find the varnish with the highest UV protection. This is key to a lasting finish. Use a minimum of two applications.
sentences: Remove door from hinges and place on a flat surface.
Tape and seal any exposed glass and remove all hardware.
Apply paint stripper generously to the entire surface.
Go back and apply paint stripper in small areas until you see it bubble off its surface.
Take the bubbled section and scrape it off with putty knife and discard.
This may require a Teflon brush in the profiles of the door.
Take a coarse sponge and clean the door with lacquer thinner.
Sand the entire door with an orbital sander.
In most cases, 120 grit works great.
You will need to hand sand the profile edges.
Keep going until you achieve a clean and smooth surface.
Apply the color of stain that you want.
Apply liberally and give the wood what it wants.
Spray a generous, yet smooth coat of exterior varnish.
Find the varnish with the highest UV protection.
This is key to a lasting finish.
Use a minimum of two applications.
